item.title: Setup Firebase RemoteConfig
item.description: In continuation with the previous article stating the benefits and working of Firebase RemoteConfig, this article will help you to set up Firebase step by step.

item.title: RemoteConfig in Firebase
item.description: In today’s fast-paced world, mobile app developers must adapt quickly to changing user preferences, market demands, and evolving business requirements. To achieve this, developers need a robust mechanism to configure apps remotely without frequent updates.

item.title: Closures: Swift
item.description: Closures are a powerful feature of the Swift programming language that allows you to write code that can be passed around and executed at a later time.

item.title: For loop with where clause: Swift
item.description: For loop is an inevitable part of any programming language. It iterates over every element of the collection type data including array, set, and dictionary, and does the operation as per the code.

item.title: Round up to n Decimal Digit: Swift
item.description: We sometimes in our calculation get results with more than 4 decimal digits or even more. But as a developer, we can’t use the same to display to users.

item.title: Map Operator: Swift
item.description: The collection is something which is used by almost everyone. It makes our life easy. Array, Set, and Dictionary are the best examples of them.

item.title: $0, $1 … $n in Swift
item.description: In order to use any parameter in a closure or a higher-order function, we need to name the parameter inside the closure or higher-order function.

item.title: Carousel View SwiftUI
item.description: The below code will help you to implement Carouel view in iOS using SwiftUI.

item.title: Filter Operator: Swift
item.description: The collection is something which is used by almost everyone. It makes our life easy. Array, Set, and Dictionary are the best examples of them.

item.title: Enumerated in Swift
item.description: Enumerated is used to iterate over a collection along with the position access. It returns a sequence of Pairs where the first element in the Pair is the index and the second element is the element itself of the collection.

item.title: Named and Unnamed Parameters: Swift
item.description: Functions are something that every developer uses daily. A function can of with or without parameters. Swift has multiple ways of passing the parameters to a function.

item.title: Labeled Statement : Swift
item.description: Swift has a few inbuilt features which make our life super easy. Labeled statements are one of them. It allows us to name a statement and later within the scope, that particular statement can be referenced using the label provided.
